intro: Trichoscypha baldwinii, commonly known as the African olive, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
